results.title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1730 18th Street in Bakersfield, California, as the "Merle Haggard Post Office Building".
results.short_title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1730 18th Street in Bakersfield, California, as the "Merle Haggard Post Office Building".
results.committees: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee
results.latest_major_action: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
results.summary: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1730 18th Street in Bakersfield, California, as the "Merle Haggard Post Office Building."
results.summary_short: Designates the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 1730 18th Street in Bakersfield, California, as the "Merle Haggard Post Office Building."

actions.description: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote. (text: CR H5402)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 1988.
Considered under suspension of the rules. (consideration: CR H5402-5403)
Mr. DeSantis moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
